title: Modern Flexbox Patterns
excerpt: Common layout patterns using CSS Flexbox.
content:
Introduction

Common layout patterns using CSS Flexbox.

Building great web experiences requires attention to detail and an understanding of modern best practices. Modern Flexbox Patterns is essential for creating fast, accessible, and maintainable websites.

Core Concepts

The web platform provides powerful APIs and features. Understanding modern flexbox patterns helps you leverage these effectively for better user experiences.

Modern browsers support increasingly sophisticated features, making it easier than ever to build rich web applications without heavy frameworks.

Implementation

Here's how to implement these techniques:

/* CSS for flexbox-patterns */
.component {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(300px, 1fr));
  gap: 1.5rem;
  container-type: inline-size;
}

@container (min-width: 400px) {
  .component__item {
    display: flex;
    align-items: center;
  }
}

This approach provides responsive behavior while keeping the code maintainable.

Performance Considerations

When implementing modern flexbox patterns, consider these performance aspects:

  • Minimize render-blocking resources
  • Optimize images and media
  • Use efficient CSS selectors
  • Leverage browser caching

Accessibility

Ensure your implementation is accessible:

  • Use semantic HTML elements
  • Provide sufficient color contrast
  • Support keyboard navigation
  • Include appropriate ARIA attributes when needed

Browser Support

Check current browser support for features you use. Progressive enhancement ensures your site works for everyone while providing enhanced experiences for modern browsers.

Conclusion

Modern Flexbox Patterns is a valuable technique for modern web development. By following these guidelines, you'll create better experiences for your users.
